Situation1: A passenger who booked through the app is waiting and urgently pressing for a quicker arrival.
Expectation2: Provide clients with clear and accurate legal advice
Situation2: The client’s case grows more complex and requires detailed guidance
Story: I glanced at the rearview mirror, watching the minutes tick by as I navigated through the late afternoon traffic. My phone buzzed again—another message from the passenger who’d booked me through the app, their words urgent, demanding I arrive faster. As a taxi driver, I prided myself on punctuality and professionalism, but the city’s congestion was beyond my control. At the same time, my other phone vibrated with a call from a client. Their case, already tangled, had just taken a complicated turn. They needed clear, immediate legal advice, and I could hear the anxiety in their voice when I answered. My mind raced, torn between the expectation to deliver a smooth, timely ride and the responsibility to provide my client with the careful, focused attention their situation deserved. The pressure mounted with every honk and every notification, my hands gripping the wheel as I wrestled with the impossible demands of both worlds, knowing I could only fully meet one at a time.
